contentList.content:
Lord Ao is the Overgod of Abeir-Toril and all deities and primordials within Realmspace are subjects to him. Also known as the Hidden One, he is generally unknown to most mortals and does not need or want their worship. Clerics of Ao are known as ministers, and the cult is more philosophical than religious in nature.

Domains: None
Alignment: None

Lord Ao is the Overgod of Abeir-Toril and all deities and primordials within Realmspace are subjects to him. Also known as the Hidden One, he is generally unknown to most mortals and does not need or want their worship. Clerics of Ao are known as ministers, and the cult is more philosophical than religious in nature.

Aoist paladins seek to spread, and enforce if necessary, the Cosmic Balance, a concept that all abstract agents of good and evil, law and chaos exist without extremes of any side gaining gaining the upper hand over the others.

The Absolute is the enigmatic power and object of worship of the Cult of the Absolute. Not much is known about this new deity, if it even is one, but its followers are fervent zealots who will crush anything or anyone standing in their way.

Domains: Knowledge, Order
Alignment: Lawful Evil

The Absolute is the enigmatic power and object of worship of the Cult of the Absolute. Not much is known about this new deity, if it even is one, but its followers are fervent zealots who will crush anything or anyone standing in their way.

The Absolute is the enigmatic power and object of worship of the Cult of the Absolute. Not much is known about this new deity, if it even is one, but its paladins are marked True Souls brandishing terrifying abilities as they lay waste to the enemies of the Absolute.

With all the planes as his board, the Lord of Lies maneuvers the forces of evil like chess pieces in his grand designs, slowly and subtly manipulating everyone from deities to lowly mortals. Asmodeus seeks complete control over all realities to satiate his need for power.

Domains: Knowledge, Order, Trickery
Alignment: Lawful Evil

With all the planes as his board, the Lord of Lies maneuvers the forces of evil like chess pieces in his grand designs, slowly and subtly manipulating everyone from deities to lowly mortals. Asmodeus seeks complete control over all realities to satiate his need for power.

With all the planes as his board, the Lord of Lies maneuvers the forces of evil like chess pieces in his grand designs, slowly and subtly manipulating everyone from deities to lowly mortals. Asmodian paladins use the same charismatic tricks to extend the reach of his influence.

Baphomet is a demon lord known as the Prince of Beasts ruling a supposedly infinite layer of the Abyss known as the Endless Maze. He is an embodiment of savagery and insidiousness who deceives his followers into embracing brutality to please him or face being devoured for failing.

Domains: Death, Strength
Alignment: Chaotic Evil

Baphomet is a demon lord known as the Prince of Beasts ruling a supposedly infinite layer of the Abyss known as the Endless Maze. He is an embodiment of savagery and insidiousness who deceives his followers into embracing brutality to please him or face being devoured for failing.

Baphomet is a demon lord known as the Prince of Beasts ruling a supposedly infinite layer of the Abyss known as the Endless Maze. He is an embodiment of savagery and insidiousness whose paladins embrace the same brutality to spill blood in his name.

Beshaba is the goddess of accidents, bad luck, and misfortune. Sister deity to Tymora, both rose from the rotting corpse of the ancient goddess of fortunate, Tyche, during an event known as the Dawn Cataclysm.

Domains: Trickery
Alignment: Chaotic Evil

Beshaba is the goddess of accidents, bad luck, and misfortune. Sister deity to Tymora, both rose from the rotting corpse of the ancient goddess of fortunate, Tyche, during an event known as the Dawn Cataclysm.
Beshaba is the goddess of accidents, bad luck, and misfortune. Paladins of Beshaba spread her doctrine through manipulation and playing on common folks morbid fears.

Gond is the god of inventiveness, crafting, and smithing, known as the Lord of All Smiths, and pushes for his worshippers to be imaginative and innovate at almost any cost. He is mostly worshipped by gnomes who know him also as Nebelun.

Domains: Forge, Knowledge
Alignment: Neutral

Gond is the god of inventiveness, crafting, and smithing, known as the Lord of All Smiths, and pushes for his worshippers to be imaginative and innovate at almost any cost. He is mostly worshipped by gnomes who know him also as Nebelun.

Gond is the god of inventiveness, crafting, and smithing, known as the Lord of All Smiths, and pushes for his worshippers to be imaginative and innovate at almost any cost. His paladins wear highly intricate suits of armor and wield technologically advanced weapons crafted by their own hands as marks of their faithfulness.

Karsus was born a mortal human, gifted with magic but cursed by his excessive arrogance and ambition. Though he only achieved apotheosis for a brief moment, but it was enough to forever change the very fabric of the Weave and bring down the then goddess of magic, Mystryl.

Domains: Arcana, Ambition
Alignment: Chaotic Neutral

Karsus was born a mortal human, gifted with magic but cursed by his excessive arrogance and ambition. Though he only achieved apotheosis for a brief moment, but it was enough to forever change the very fabric of the Weave and bring down the then goddess of magic, Mystryl.

Karsus was born a mortal human, gifted with magic but cursed by his excessive arrogance and ambition. Karsite paladins, though a rare sight, often mirror his ambitious spirit but try to avoid allowing the same arrogance to cloud their judgement.

The patron deity of the illithids, the Tentacled Lord embodies their ideals of mental prowess, unlimited knowledge, and willful enslavement of the thoughts of others.

Domains: Arcana, Knowledge, Order, Mind
Alignment: Lawful Evil
The patron deity of the illithids, the Tentacled Lord embodies their ideals of mental prowess, unlimited knowledge, and willful enslavement of the thoughts of others.

The patron deity of the illithids, the Tentacled Lord embodies their ideals of mental prowess, unlimited knowledge, and willful enslavement of the thoughts of others. Paladins of Ilsensine are usually thralls of a local mind flayer colony, spreading the illithid domain against their will.

Loviatar is the evil goddess of agony and pain and is both queen and servant to the quasi-deity Bane. Her portfolio encompasses suffering and torture holding true to her title as Maiden of Pain and her followers will often engage in self-flagellation while praying for their daily spells.

Domains: Death
Alignment: Lawful Evil

Loviatar is the evil goddess of agony and pain and is both queen and servant to the quasi-deity Bane. Her portfolio encompasses suffering and torture holding true to her title as Maiden of Pain and her followers will often engage in self-flagellation while praying for their daily spells.

Loviatar is the evil goddess of agony and pain and is both queen and servant to the quasi-deity Bane. Her portfolio encompasses suffering and torture holding true to her title as Maiden of Pain and her paladins aim to bring her holy pain and suffering through physical means or psychological torture.

Milil is the venerated deity of music, poetry, eloquence, and creativity. He represents the whole of the creative process, from a song's conception to its completion, inspiration to execution, and how life itself is but a mirror of it.

Domains: Light
Alignment: Neutral Good

Milil is the venerated deity of music, poetry, eloquence, and creativity. He represents the whole of the creative process, from a song's conception to its completion, inspiration to execution, and how life itself is but a mirror of it.

The Raven Queen is the interloper goddess of fate, death, and life. She is revered by the shadar-kai, a race of former elves warped by a failed attempt at divine apotheosis by the Raven Queen in the past.

Domains: Life, Death
Alignment: Lawful Neutral

The Raven Queen is the interloper goddess of fate, death, and life. She is revered by the shadar-kai, a race of former elves warped by a failed attempt at divine apotheosis by the Raven Queen in the past.

The Raven Queen is the interloper goddess of fate, death, and life. Her paladins brave the darkest regions of the Shadowfell to collect the memories and essences of grief and loss; mementos highly desired by the Raven Queen.

Sune is the goddess of love in all its forms. The Lady of Love embodies not only physical attractiveness but also the deeper experiences of love, desire, and the transformative power of beauty, whether it be in art, music, or personal connection.

Domains: Life, Light
Alignment: Chaotic Good

Sune is the goddess of love in all its forms. The Lady of Love embodies not only physical attractiveness but also the deeper experiences of love, desire, and the transformative power of beauty, whether it be in art, music, or personal connection.

Not merely the good right hand of Tyr, Torm is the god of duty, loyalty, righteousness, and obedience. He represents the principle of forbearance and the chivalric ideals which his followers exemplify.

Domains: War
Alignment: Lawful Good

Not merely the good right hand of Tyr, Torm is the god of duty, loyalty, righteousness, and obedience. He represents the principle of forbearance and the chivalric ideals which his followers exemplify.

Umberlee is a vain and malicious deity who uses the harshness of the sea to exercise her power, drowning wayward ships without a moment's hesitation. She is most often worshiped by sailors and seafarers in a vain attempt to appease the petty god for safe passage.

Domains: Tempest
Alignment: Chaotic Evil

Umberlee is a vain and malicious deity who uses the harshness of the sea to exercise her power, drowning wayward ships without a moment's hesitation. She is most often worshiped by sailors and seafarers in a vain attempt to appease the petty god for safe passage.

Umberlee is a vain and malicious deity who uses the harshness of the sea to exercise her power, drowning wayward ships without a moment's hesitation. Umberlant paladins and other worshippers reflected their goddesses chaotic nature; the church was disorganized, hated, and spread out of fear instead of dogmatic principle.

Vecna is the much maligned arch-lich who rose to godhood and continues to seek the destruction of the other gods to acquire more power for himself. Owing to his own perspective as a former mortal who had gained knowledge over life and death, it is not uncommon for Vecna to sponspor pacts with warlocks as their undying patron.

Domains: Arcana, Death, Knowledge
Alignment: Neutral Evil

Vecna is the much maligned arch-lich who rose to godhood and continues to seek the destruction of the other gods to acquire more power for himself. Owing to his own perspective as a former mortal who had gained knowledge over life and death, it is not uncommon for Vecna to sponspor pacts with warlocks as their undying patron.

Vecna is the much maligned arch-lich who rose to godhood and continues to seek the destruction of the other gods to acquire more power for himself. His wholly evil paladins work in secret to keep knowledge away from those they deem unworthy to know it and seek out lost and ancient arcana.

Verenestra is the fey deity of female fey, charm, and beauty, always appearing barefooted and wearing only gossamer garmets of negligible size to provide any pretense of modesty. She is also fickle, vain, and jealous and despised being in the company of other goddesses of beauty or love.

Domains: Trickery
Alignment: Neutral

Verenestra is the fey deity of female fey, charm, and beauty, always appearing barefooted and wearing only gossamer garmets of negligible size to provide any pretense of modesty. She is also fickle, vain, and jealous and despised being in the company of other goddesses of beauty or love.

Waukeen is the lesser deity of wealth and trade. Known as The Merchant's Friend, she was venerated by not only merchants but any person involved with money. From lowly peddlers to wealthy trading company owners, investors, accountants, entrepreneurs, philanthropists, moneylenders, and even smugglers, fences, and black marketeers.

Domains: Knowledge, Trickery
Alignment: Neutral

Waukeen is the lesser deity of wealth and trade. Known as The Merchant's Friend, she was venerated by not only merchants but any person involved with money. From lowly peddlers to wealthy trading company owners, investors, accountants, entrepreneurs, philanthropists, moneylenders, and even smugglers, fences, and black marketeers.

Zerthimon was the philosophical prophet and leader of a splinter group of gith who became known as the githzerai. He fought in the liberation wars against the mind flayers before the disagreement about the future of his people's new found freedom embroiled them in a bloody civil war.

Domains: Peace, Order
Alignment: Lawful Neutral

Zerthimon was the philosophical prophet and leader of a splinter group of gith who became known as the githzerai. He fought in the liberation wars against the mind flayers before the disagreement about the future of his people's new found freedom embroiled them in a bloody civil war.

Zerthimon was the philosophical prophet and leader of a splinter group of gith who became known as the githzerai. Githzerai paladins fighting in his name wield fearsome psionic abilities from years of monastic training in Limbo.

Born of three great Elven goddesses, Angharradh is the chief goddess of the Seldarine pantheon and consort of Corellon. In times of peace she wore gems of starlight. In the hour of war, she donned suit of silver mail.

Domains: Knowledge, Life, Peace, War
Alignment: Chaotic Good

Born of three great Elven goddesses, Angharradh is the chief goddess of the Seldarine pantheon and consort of Corellon. In times of peace she wore gems of starlight. In the hour of war, she donned suit of silver mail.

Annam All-Father is the chief Giant deity and creator of the Giant race, he is an omniscient god of learning and meditation who could spend a thousand years contemplating a single subject, while at the same time being an entity who acts on impulse and instinct.

Domains: Knowledge
Alignment: Lawful Neutral

Annam All-Father is the chief Giant deity and creator of the Giant race, he is an omniscient god of learning and meditation who could spend a thousand years contemplating a single subject, while at the same time being an entity who acts on impulse and instinct.

Goddess of winter and cold, Auril is the embodiment of winter's cruelty. The only thing colder than her bitter gales was her lethal beauty and heart of ice as the Cold Goddess would make her season even more frigid to remind the people in the north who controlled the cold.

Domains: Nature, Tempest
Alignment: Neutral Evil

Goddess of winter and cold, Auril is the embodiment of winter's cruelty. The only thing colder than her bitter gales was her lethal beauty and heart of ice as the Cold Goddess would make her season even more frigid to remind the people in the north who controlled the cold.

Servant of Mystra, and lesser deity of arcane magic, Azuth is worshipped by all types of arcane spell casters, especially Wizards. The Lord of Spells concerns included the perpetuation of the magical arts as a craft.

Domains: Lawful Neutral
Alignment: Arcana, Knowledge

Servant of Mystra, and lesser deity of arcane magic, Azuth is worshipped by all types of arcane spell casters, especially Wizards. The Lord of Spells concerns included the perpetuation of the magical arts as a craft.

Bibdoolpoolp is the patron goddess of the kua-toa of questionable sanity, said to be madder than any storm that ever raged across the wild seas. She views the kuo-toa as her children, though she seldom gave them anything other than the creations of her crazed imagination.

Domains: Death
Alignment: Neutral Evil

Bibdoolpoolp is the patron goddess of the kua-toa of questionable sanity, said to be madder than any storm that ever raged across the wild seas. She views the kuo-toa as her children, though she seldom gave them anything other than the creations of her crazed imagination.

Celestian the Far Wanderer is an enigmatic deity from the world of Oerth revered by planewalkers and wildspace wanderers. Also known as the Star Wanderer, Celestian has the power to traverse the Astral Plane at will, including the ability to astrally enter any of the planes that bordered it.

Domains: Knowledge, Twilight
Alignment: Neutral

Celestian the Far Wanderer is an enigmatic deity from the world of Oerth revered by planewalkers and wildspace wanderers. Also known as the Star Wanderer, Celestian has the power to traverse the Astral Plane at will, including the ability to astrally enter any of the planes that bordered it.

Clangeddin Silverbeard is the main Dwarven god of war. An honourable fighter, he lived, breathed, and in some ways died for warfare.

Domains: War
Alignment: Lawful Good
Clangeddin Silverbeard is the main Dwarven god of war. An honourable fighter, he lived, breathed, and in some ways died for warfare.

Cyric is the monomaniacal Faerunian god of lies, trickery, and strife, having previously held dominion over tyranny, murder, lies, death, intrigue, and illusion. Cyric was once a handsome man before madness, murder, and ambition turned him into a ghoulish outcast.

Domains: Trickery
Alignment: Chaotic Evil

Cyric is the monomaniacal Faerunian god of lies, trickery, and strife, having previously held dominion over tyranny, murder, lies, death, intrigue, and illusion. Cyric was once a handsome man before madness, murder, and ambition turned him into a ghoulish outcast.

Beloved of Sea Elves and other creatures of the watery world, Deep Sashelas is often perceived by his faithful as a twinkle of light leading them to safety.

Domains: Knowledge, Nature, Tempest
Alignment: Chaotic Good
Beloved of Sea Elves and other creatures of the watery world, Deep Sashelas is often perceived by his faithful as a twinkle of light leading them to safety.

Deneir is the scribe of Oghma and deity of art, cartography, glyphs, images, knowledge, literature, and scholars, whose great ambition was to find the Metatext, a single perfect work of writing that would unlock the secrets of the multiverse.

Domains: Arcana, Knowledge
Alignment: Neutral Good

Deneir is the scribe of Oghma and deity of art, cartography, glyphs, images, knowledge, literature, and scholars, whose great ambition was to find the Metatext, a single perfect work of writing that would unlock the secrets of the multiverse.

Patron of shield dwarves, and is the dwarven deity of mining, Dumathoin is known as the Keeper of Secrets Under the Mountain. He also acts as the protector of the dwarven dead.

Domains: Death, Knowledge
Alignment: Neutral
Patron of shield dwarves, and is the dwarven deity of mining, Dumathoin is known as the Keeper of Secrets Under the Mountain. He also acts as the protector of the dwarven dead.

Eadro is the creator of the locathah and merfolk and was worshiped exclusively by those two races, though each worshiped him differently. Eadro is a member of the asathalfinare pantheon, an alliance of good aligned gods of acquatic races.

Domains: Nature, Tempest
Alignment: Neutral

Eadro is the creator of the locathah and merfolk and was worshiped exclusively by those two races, though each worshiped him differently. Eadro is a member of the asathalfinare pantheon, an alliance of good aligned gods of acquatic races.

Eldath is a lake spirit who is worshipped as a goddess of peace and calm waters. She protected all waters, and was felt whenever they were calm.

Domains: Life, Nature, Peace
Alignment: Neutral Good
Eldath is a lake spirit who is worshipped as a goddess of peace and calm waters. She protected all waters, and was felt whenever they were calm.

Garyx is the chaotic evil dragon god of fire and destruction. He also symbolised rebirth and renewal, and his flames were often seen as a precursor of new life.

Domains: Death, Light, War
Alignment: Chaotic Evil
Garyx is the chaotic evil dragon god of fire and destruction. He also symbolised rebirth and renewal, and his flames were often seen as a precursor of new life.

Graz'zt is the demon prince of pleasure, decadence, and unlimited self-indulgence, he acts as the patron for corrupt authorities and tyrants who ruled by force.

Domains: Death, Trickery
Alignment: Chaotic Evil
Graz'zt is the demon prince of pleasure, decadence, and unlimited self-indulgence, he acts as the patron for corrupt authorities and tyrants who ruled by force.

Hruggek is the chief deity of bugbears and was once an exarch of Bane. He loves a good ambush, brawl, and any form or subterfuge and violence.

Domains: War
Alignment: Chaotic Evil
Hruggek is the chief deity of bugbears and was once an exarch of Bane. He loves a good ambush, brawl, and any form or subterfuge and violence.

Ioun is an interloper goddess of knowledge, skill, and prophecy from Nerath who somehow is able to influence events in Toril. Worshiped by sages and scribes, she had great skill in all forms of knowledge and prophecy.

Domains: Knowledge
Alignment: Neutral

Ioun is an interloper goddess of knowledge, skill, and prophecy from Nerath who somehow is able to influence events in Toril. Worshiped by sages and scribes, she had great skill in all forms of knowledge and prophecy.

Kereska is the dragon goddess of magic, specifically dragon magic and magical creativity. Also titled the Light of Magic, Kereska could endow her favorites with whatever magical abilities that she wished to.

Domains: Arcana
Alignment: Chaotic Neutral

Kereska is the dragon goddess of magic, specifically dragon magic and magical creativity. Also titled the Light of Magic, Kereska could endow her favorites with whatever magical abilities that she wished to.

Leira is the goddess of deception and illusions. Also known as the Lady of Deception or the Lady of Mists, she is the patroness of illusionists and liars.

Domains: Trickery
Alignment: Chaotic Neutral
Leira is the goddess of deception and illusions. Also known as the Lady of Deception or the Lady of Mists, she is the patroness of illusionists and liars.

Lliira, a lesser goddess of joy, is lively and ever changing. She embodied happiness and freedom, and is beloved of poets, musicians, and all who revelled in the variety of life.

Domains: Life
Alignment: Chaotic Good
Lliira, a lesser goddess of joy, is lively and ever changing. She embodied happiness and freedom, and is beloved of poets, musicians, and all who revelled in the variety of life.

Maglubiyet is the chief deity of goblins and hobgoblins and exarch of the greater deity Bane. As the goblinoid god of war and leadership, Maglubiyet rules with an iron fist. His leadership was challenged by the Cult of the Absolute, who stole many of his followers.

Domains: Order, War
Alignment: Lawful Evil

Maglubiyet is the chief deity of goblins and hobgoblins and exarch of the greater deity Bane. As the goblinoid god of war and leadership, Maglubiyet rules with an iron fist. His leadership was challenged by the Cult of the Absolute, who stole many of his followers.

Malar is the lesser deity of hunting, stalking, bloodlust, and bestial savagery. A bestial deity, the Beastlord is the epitome of the dark, bloody side of nature. Malar acts as an exarch of Silvanus and is worshiped by those who identified with the wild nature, as well as the grace and amorality of predators or as the hunger and hunting instinct of beasts.

Domains: Nature
Alignment: Chaotic Evil

Malar is the lesser deity of hunting, stalking, bloodlust, and bestial savagery. A bestial deity, the Beastlord is the epitome of the dark, bloody side of nature. Malar acts as an exarch of Silvanus and is worshiped by those who identified with the wild nature, as well as the grace and amorality of predators or as the hunger and hunting instinct of beasts.

Mask is the intermediate god of shadows, thievery, and formerly intrigue. The Lord of Shadows is a loner god most often associated with those of ill-repute.

Domains: Trickery
Alignment: Chaotic Neutral
Mask is the intermediate god of shadows, thievery, and formerly intrigue. The Lord of Shadows is a loner god most often associated with those of ill-repute.

Savras is the deity of wizards, divination, fate and truth, who acquiesced the position as god of spellcasters to Azuth. Also known as He of the Third Eye, Savras guids the forces of destiny.

Domains: Arcana, Knowledge
Alignment: Lawful Neutral
Savras is the deity of wizards, divination, fate and truth, who acquiesced the position as god of spellcasters to Azuth. Also known as He of the Third Eye, Savras guids the forces of destiny.

Daughter of the night skies and goddess of Moonlight, Sehanine Moonbow is an elven goddess of death, dreams, heavens, journeys, full moon, moon elves, stars, and transcendence.

Domains: Grave, Knowledge, Light
Alignment: Chaotic Good
Daughter of the night skies and goddess of Moonlight, Sehanine Moonbow is an elven goddess of death, dreams, heavens, journeys, full moon, moon elves, stars, and transcendence.

Patron deity of the lizardfolk and their god of survival, Semuanya is a dualistic deity who could take the form of either a hunter or a breeder, whichever her worshippers required.

Domains: Life
Alignment: Neutral
Patron deity of the lizardfolk and their god of survival, Semuanya is a dualistic deity who could take the form of either a hunter or a breeder, whichever her worshippers required.

Skoraeus Stonebones is the giant god of craftmanship and that which was buried. Known as the Great Creator by his people, he is introverted and intelligent, and preferred to create his masterpieces underground.

Domains: Knowledge
Alignment: Neutral

Skoraeus Stonebones is the giant god of craftmanship and that which was buried. Known as the Great Creator by his people, he is introverted and intelligent, and preferred to create his masterpieces underground.

Talona is the goddess of disease and poison, she is a vile goddess who flourished wherever misery and disaster were present. Worship of the Mother of All Plagues waxed and waned in an unending cycle; the Mistress of Disease would unleash waves of death-bringing blights, after which came mass entreaties for respite before that cycle's great plagues went into remission, her power slowly declined, and spurred by feelings of vulnerability, she began the cycle anew.

Domains: Death
Alignment: Chaotic Evil

Talona is the goddess of disease and poison, she is a vile goddess who flourished wherever misery and disaster were present. Worship of the Mother of All Plagues waxed and waned in an unending cycle; the Mistress of Disease would unleash waves of death-bringing blights, after which came mass entreaties for respite before that cycle's great plagues went into remission, her power slowly declined, and spurred by feelings of vulnerability, she began the cycle anew.

De facto leader of the Frost Giants, Thrym is a powerful titan who delighted in war. He is worshiped by the frost giants as the giant god of cold and ice.

Domains: War
Alignment: Chaotic Evil
De facto leader of the Frost Giants, Thrym is a powerful titan who delighted in war. He is worshiped by the frost giants as the giant god of cold and ice.

Amaunator is the Faer√ªnian god of the sun and law. Amaunator was also worshiped in the ancient Netherese empire as the solar deity. Once thought long-dormant and supplanted by Lathander, he is worshiped in present day under his own name.

Domains: Life, Light
Alignment: Lawful Neutral

Amaunator is the Faer√ªnian god of the sun and law. Amaunator was also worshiped in the ancient Netherese empire as the solar deity. Once thought long-dormant and supplanted by Lathander, he is worshiped in present day under his own name.

The Red Knight is the god of strategy and battle tactics and serves as an exarch of Tempus. Appearing in blood-red plate mail, she had a commanding presence that drew attention and respect of all who bore witness.

Domains: War
Alignment: Lawful Neutral

The Red Knight is the god of strategy and battle tactics and serves as an exarch of Tempus. Appearing in blood-red plate mail, she had a commanding presence that drew attention and respect of all who bore witness.

Sharess is the goddess of hedonism, lust, and sensual fulfillment and is known as Bast in the Mulhorandi pantheon. Her clergy are commonly seen running festhalls throughout Faer√ªn, places that indulge every pleasure imaginable.

Domains: War
Alignment: Chaotic Good

Sharess is the goddess of hedonism, lust, and sensual fulfillment and is known as Bast in the Mulhorandi pantheon. Her clergy are commonly seen running festhalls throughout Faer√ªn, places that indulge every pleasure imaginable.

Shaundakul is a lesser deity of travel, exploration, and portals. He has a small, but dedicated, clergy who maintain a few temples throughout the world. He is known to appear before his worshipers or those in desperate need of help, in an effort to grow his mortal flock.

Domains: Knowledge, Nature
Alignment: Chaotic Neutral

Shaundakul is a lesser deity of travel, exploration, and portals. He has a small, but dedicated, clergy who maintain a few temples throughout the world. He is known to appear before his worshipers or those in desperate need of help, in an effort to grow his mortal flock.
